resources.string: RGIS & NEW LOOK PRE-INVENTORY VISIT/ CALL OVERVIEW
The Pre-Inventory Visit/ Call must be completed 7-14 days prior to store inventory date for all Stores. It is recommended to be completed with the Store Manager only.
You must ensure you complete Exhibit 1a and Exhibit 1b At a PIV leave copy 1b with the Store Manager to complete any agreed actions. For a PIC leave a copy of section 1 b in the store packet.

For a PIV it is recommended that you take a minimum of 30 minutes to review the store, you should walk all areas of the store with the Store Manager – you should review the agreements made on this form on the day of inventory, identifying any follow on actions and support that is required to perform an accurate inventory count.
! NL Colleague involvement required for Head Counts, ticketing , preparation assistance, etc.
! Care of Stock – Store must provide RGIS will dedicated Totes / Rails for Sin Bin
! Communication both pre / during and post inventory should be concise, clear and real-time
! Style / Colour / Size Process – Ensure you, the store colleagues and ALL RGIS ASET’s are aware of the correct process
Walk and discuss preparation needs in depth, including the below points to be used as a guideline, noting actions and agreements made.
- How many NL Staff will be available during the inventory for Head Counts?
- Discuss the Security and Travel/Parking Arrangements

- Emphasize sales floor recovery and preparation requirements (labels/barcodes exposed). Back Room preparation is equally as important (loose or tote stock needs to be sorted, re-labelled etc). Check fitting rooms.
- Pair Footwear, ensure that each pair is the correct size
- Accessories – to ensure accuracy and efficiency the accessories should be recovered on the day prior to being counted.
- Sin Bin Areas – where will the spare totes and rails be placed to ensure RGIS do not place stock on the floor?
- Explain and review the accuracy process with the Store Manager – does he/she have any questions?
- Explain and review the Head Count process with the store manager – does he/she understand the stores role in this?
- Establish a Control Desk Location and review the required Store input at pre-inventory briefing.
- If the store is in a shopping mall ensure the Centre Management / Security are aware of the count.
Ensure you review the below Actions & Agreements on the inventory count day.
